column4: hello, people. firstly sorry for bad english. i have  a question. of course i'm using ubuntu and has internet access via dialup (USR 56K Faxmodem (Sportster) ext.). i've installed gnome-ppd, configured it BUT, it can't initialize modem. i trie dto edit ~/.wvdial.conf but it rewrites it each time before initializing. so what to do?
the problem is in ATZ string
you know for sure the correct configuration?
i think so
it send ATZ string to modem and it replies "!z"
manually, you can get wvdial to connect to the ISP (with or without fully networking)?
yes
try installing gnome-ppp. It's more customisable than the gnome networking dialogue
lol. read higher. i've installed gnome-ppp but have problems with initialization
oh, damn.  you could add a launcher to the gnome panel to run the wvdial command that you know is working, as a workaround
it sounds like a flaw in the software: a polite email to the developers might be an idea too
but i think i've asked question correctly :)
yes, absolutely! not your fault at all
actually...gnome-ppp setup dialogue allows you to make custom init strings
yes, i know about this feature, BUT...it starts from Init2 and there isn't "Init" string where ATZ is located :)
I /think/ that ATZ is resetting your modem, so it doesn't matter what init1 is
my modem can't recognize that string. there'
I think that you'd be best making a launcher on the panel for wvdial :-/
thank you for help, i'll follow your advice
have you tried right-clicking on the file and opening in rhythmbox?  the way rhythmbox was intended to be used, you "add to library" from the application, a directory at a time
yup. but it doesn't play anything :\
